comments:
build 20031119

1) started with a new workspace
2) imported plug-in org.eclipse.ui.editors and required ones as binary
3) added a new CVS connection to dev.eclipse.org as anonymous
4) started to check out the same projects as in my workspace selecting one to 
two in the repositories view and choosing "Check out"

Having around 3-4 parallel checkout sessions running, the checkouts failed 
with the following exceptions:

Assigning to VCM although more likely a cross component issue.

When trying to get my workspace in a usable form by selecting all source 
projects and retrying to replace them with HEAD, I see the following exception:

org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: 
Lock cannot be released because it is not owned.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.OrderedLock.release
(OrderedLock.java:222)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkManager.checkOut
(WorkManager.java:133)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.endOperation
(Workspace.java:859)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.InternalWorkspaceJob.run
(InternalWorkspaceJob.java:44)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:62)

Obviously Core has turned on deadloack detection in the milestone week! At a 
minimum they should have tested the CVS operations. 

To start, the scenarios you have listed have worked for a while without 
deadlock. My guess is that the deadlock detection algorithm is faulty. Most of 
the deadlock cases below are related to the internal resources lock.

We will have to talk with John about this.

Core has had the deadlock detection enabled for a while, and the logs are 
actually mostly related to new assertions that in some cases are invalid. Core 
will be removing for 12pm build.

If CVS is really causing deadlocks, then they have always occured and we can 
investigate post-M6. The more pressing issue is for Core to fix the assertions 
because they would actually leave your workspace in a bad state. Basically, 
the assertion was causing cleanup code to be skipped.

I don't believe there is a real CVS deadlock.  After fixing bug 46894 we were
unable make the deadlock happen.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 46894 ***
